Endgame summary

RULES

General
Spoiler:
1. By participating in this game, you acknowledge and agree to abide by the sitewide rules.
2. Bolded #800000 - i.e. text looking like this - is what I will use if I need to edit someone's post; to avoid confusion, please do not format any of your text in this way.
3. Do not try to impersonate me.
4. Do not use encrypted text. (Steganography does not fall under this rule.)
5. Do not use small text below size 70 (this size).
6. Once you are dead, you can no longer post in the thread. No "Bah!" posts.
7. Extreme or excessive personal attacks will not be tolerated. Attack the play, not the player.

Voting
Spoiler:
8. Votes should preferably be made using the voting tags (VOTE: Player Name), but you may also format them by bolding the word "Vote:" and the name of the player whom you want to vote for, which should be written immediately after the colon (Vote: Player Name). Incorrectly formatted votes will not be counted. You may abbreviate names as long there's no ambiguity about who you're referring to.
9. Unvotes should preferably be made using the unvoting tags, but you may also format them by putting the word "Unvote", in bold, on a separate line. Unvotes are not necessary when changing your vote from one player to another, but can be helpful.
10. When more than half of the living players have voted for a particular person, that person will be lynched. It is not possible to prevent the lynch with votes or unvotes cast after the "hammer" vote.
11. If a majority is not reached by the given deadline, the day will end without a lynch. You may also vote to end the day without lynching by voting for "No Lynch".

Day & Night Phases
Spoiler:
12. Each day phase will last 2 weeks and each night phase 48 hours.
13. I reserve the right to extend day or night phases in special circumstances.
14. Night begins as soon as I lock the thread following a lynch. You may continue to post up until the thread has been locked.
15. During the night, you have up until the given deadline to submit any night actions you may have. You should do this by PMing them to me or telling me about them in a factional PT you have in this game. If you expect you won't be here during the night and have a night action you want to submit, you may submit it to me via PM/PT in advance.

Activity & Prods
Spoiler:
16. You have 36 hours from receiving your role PM to reply, confirming you've read it, or else you will be replaced.
17. You should post in the game thread at least once every 48 hours. If you go more than 48 hours without posting while not on V/LA (see rule 19), I will prod you, meaning you will receive a PM reminding you to post. Posts that do not contain game-related content will not reset your prod timer.
18. If you do not post in the game thread within 24 hours of being prodded, I will begin searching for someone to replace you.
19. If you have been prodded three times during the course of the game and go more than 48 hours without posting, I will not prod you a fourth time, and will instead search for someone to replace you.
20. If you expect to be away from the thread for more than 48 hours, you may announce in-thread or via PM to me that you will be on V/LA (Vacation/Limited Access) and when this will take place. You will not receive prods during this time. I reserve the right to deny you the privilege of being exempt from prods if you are on V/LA excessively.

Miscellaneous
Spoiler:
21. If you have a personal problem with another player or wish to request moderator action against another player, please PM me about it and do not discuss it in-thread.
22. Pretending to break a certain rule or trying to exploit a "loophole" in a rule will be taken just as seriously as breaking the rule.
23. If you spot any kind of error I've made anywhere in the thread, please let me know in-thread or via PM as soon as possible.


TL;DR
  • Standard deadlines, lynching mechanics, etc.
  • Bolded #800000 is my colour.
  • No text below size 70 (this).
  • No "Bah!" posts.
  • No prod-dodging.
  • Bolded votes don't count if you miss out the colon.

SET-UP INFORMATION

This game uses an open set-up comprised of:

2 Mafia Goons
1 Ascetic Mafia Traitor
3 Town Bodyguards
1 Weak Town Bodyguard
6 Vanilla Townies

Scum do not have daytalk.

Reviewed by Antihero, Marquis, and mykonian.
(who helped this go from terrible to not-so-terrible<3<3)


Additional Information
  • If multiple bodyguards target the same player and that player is shot, all of the bodyguards will die.
  • The "weak" modifier cannot be circumvented via protection by another bodyguard.
  • Bodyguards can only die in place of someone targeted by a kill. In a chain of bodyguards, only the bodyguard protecting the nightkill target will die.

Spoiler: Role PMs

You are a Vanilla Townie.

You have no special abilities.

You win when all threats to the Town have been eliminated.

The game thread can be found here.

Please confirm you have received and read this PM by replying with your role name and alignment.

You are a Town Bodyguard.

Each night, you have the option to target a player of your choice to protect; if this player is targeted by a kill during that night, you will die in their place. This effect resolves regardless of whether the player you are targeting is receiving any additional protection.

You win when all threats to the Town have been eliminated.

The game thread can be found here.

Please confirm you have received and read this PM by replying with your role name and alignment.

You are a Weak Town Bodyguard.

Each night, you have the option to target a player of your choice to protect; if this player is targeted by a kill during that night, you will die in their place. This effect resolves regardless of whether the player you are targeting is receiving any additional protection.

Additionally, you are weak. This means that if you target a Mafia-aligned player, you will die. The effect of this modifier cannot be circumvented via protection by another Bodyguard.

You win when all threats to the Town have been eliminated.

The game thread can be found here.

Please confirm you have received and read this PM by replying with your role name and alignment.

You are a Mafia Goon.

Your partners are <player name>, who is also a Mafia Goon, and an unknown 3rd faction member, who is an Ascetic Mafia Traitor and knows your identities.

You share a factional kill, which you may use to target one player each night; that player will die and exit the game. You do not need to choose which one of you will perform the kill.

You also share a factional private thread, located here.
You may use it to communicate with each other during night phases. It will be locked during the day.

You win when all members of the Town have been eliminated or nothing can prevent this from happening.

The game thread can be found here.

Please confirm you have received and read this PM by replying with your role name and alignment.

You are an Ascetic Mafia Traitor.

Your partners are <player name> and <player name>, who are Mafia Goons.
They do not know your identity.

Additionally, you are ascetic. This means that you cannot be targeted by any night actions except kills.

You win when all members of the Town have been eliminated or nothing can prevent this from happening. If both of your partners are dead, you are automatically endgamed and lose.

The game thread can be found here.

Please confirm you have received and read this PM by replying with your role name and alignment.

Role PMs will be sent out momentarily.
Everyone has 36 hours to respond.

The game will begin when at least 10/13 players have confirmed.
Nearly all player have confirmed; day 1 begins now!

A quick PSA: I was asked about who dies in a chain of bodyguards, where one bodyguard protects another. I should clarify this issue now to avoid confusion.

As stated in the bodyguard role PM, a bodyguard will die in the place of someone targeted by a kill. If a bodyguard protects a player that is targeted by the nightkill, any bodyguards protecting the aforementioned bodyguard will not prevent them from dying.
For example, if player A protects player B and player B protects C and player C is targeted by the nightkill, player B will die and nothing will happen to player A.

This is to stop the set-up from getting unnecessarily complicated and prevent circular protection.
I have added this information to the opening post containing the details of the set-up.

But there's good reason to announce that the game is broken if he's scum. This is a fairly simple setup. Really, any way to break this game has to revolve around the weak bodyguard role. If he's scum, he probably assumed other people had figured it out too. Scum RC would assume the game's going to be "broken" somehow and that he might as well be the one who does it.

Obviously, this is all pretty contingent on how game-breaking this strategy is. Personally, I'm skeptical of it. It's been reviewed by like 3 people and I've thought about how to break it myself. I'm thinking this game-breaking strategy probably only marginally helps us, if it does at all.

Spoiler: Baggage, Optional Reading
I am frustrated with forum mafia right now and I haven't had a good game since way back at Christmas with Badass Female UPick. I love the concept of mafia because I read crappy Victorian mysteries all the time and I like the puzzle solving aspect, but in the last few months the games I've played have just turned out terribly. This was in no small part because I've had a pretty bad streak of drawing scum and I absolutely hate being scum. Posting becomes a chore and I drag my feet. I'm no good at telling people what they want to hear because I'm already socially awkward and it's not one of my strengths. It doesn't help that I have the charisma and likability of a dried up cat turd. The couple times I did draw town, I become an emotional, bitter wreck and by the end of the game I ended up turning into a heinous bitch that was pissed off at everybody.

So coming into this game, I thought I would have the attitude of just trying to enjoy the game and just letting my reads develop at their own pace. These usually don't roll around for a while. I am super slow because I always try to consider all the different interpretations of people's posts and their implications. I only end up sharing about 5% of what I think just because most of it ends up being garbage. (As a side note, this is a large part of the reason why you will see me in hydra games a lot more often than solo games. My hydra partner deals with people and I can take my sweet ass time.)

So, when I saw BNL say "You're not making content on page 2, you're scum!" I was immensely annoyed and just immediately went into bitch mode because I thought "It's not going to be one of those games again, is it?" I'm not sharing what I'm thinking because I'm not ready yet, but I am keeping up and giving this some thought. The old me probably would've ignored BNL and just kept grabassing until she got better reads. But sadly the old me is dead, beaten to a bloody pulp by games of disappointment, mislynches, and angst. Now, getting pushed for bad reasons bugs the shit out of me and drains me. None of this is BNL's fault, but it is how it is.


That was largely irrelevant and probably doesn't make any sense, but I had to vent and get that off my chest now.

I have to go deal with people in RL now. This'll be an adventure. I'll be back this evening.

In post 75, TellTaleHeart wrote:
In post 57, Apricity wrote:42 from TTH feels like a bit of an overreaction to what BNL said.

It is.

Spoiler: Baggage, Optional Reading
I am frustrated with forum mafia right now and I haven't had a good game since way back at Christmas with Badass Female UPick. I love the concept of mafia because I read crappy Victorian mysteries all the time and I like the puzzle solving aspect, but in the last few months the games I've played have just turned out terribly. This was in no small part because I've had a pretty bad streak of drawing scum and I absolutely hate being scum. Posting becomes a chore and I drag my feet. I'm no good at telling people what they want to hear because I'm already socially awkward and it's not one of my strengths. It doesn't help that I have the charisma and likability of a dried up cat turd. The couple times I did draw town, I become an emotional, bitter wreck and by the end of the game I ended up turning into a heinous bitch that was pissed off at everybody.

So coming into this game, I thought I would have the attitude of just trying to enjoy the game and just letting my reads develop at their own pace. These usually don't roll around for a while. I am super slow because I always try to consider all the different interpretations of people's posts and their implications. I only end up sharing about 5% of what I think just because most of it ends up being garbage. (As a side note, this is a large part of the reason why you will see me in hydra games a lot more often than solo games. My hydra partner deals with people and I can take my sweet ass time.)

So, when I saw BNL say "You're not making content on page 2, you're scum!" I was immensely annoyed and just immediately went into bitch mode because I thought "It's not going to be one of those games again, is it?" I'm not sharing what I'm thinking because I'm not ready yet, but I am keeping up and giving this some thought. The old me probably would've ignored BNL and just kept grabassing until she got better reads. But sadly the old me is dead, beaten to a bloody pulp by games of disappointment, mislynches, and angst. Now, getting pushed for bad reasons bugs the shit out of me and drains me. None of this is BNL's fault, but it is how it is.


That was largely irrelevant and probably doesn't make any sense, but I had to vent and get that off my chest now.

I have to go deal with people in RL now. This'll be an adventure. I'll be back this evening.

I really don't understand the purpose of bodyguards and it really is just nonsense to me. At night, there is going to be some kill, and if a bodyguard protects that kill and dies instead, doesn't that hurt town by not knowing who the mafia's true target was? In my opinion, for the most part bodyguards should just ignore their action. Or someone could explain to me why bodyguards help/matter.

this may have been answered already but:

if a bodyguard dies instead of a weak bodyguard, this is a good thing, because a bodyguard cannot act as a cop
if a bodyguard dies instead of any other kill, it's a bad thing, because of the reason you mentioned in your post

if multiple bodyguards target a the person who the mafia try to kill, due to lack of claiming, this is BAD because they both die.

basically, if all bodyguards claim, and claim their targets, and DON'T target the same person as other bodyguards, scum can do no better than one kill per night, AND they CANNOT kill the target they want (ostensibly even if it was a strongman kill) due to how the bodyguard role works.

since we have 3 bodyguards, we can FORCE at least 3 investigations, unless one of them is scum, at which point our luck runs out.

SO, the BEST BEST BEST course of action for town is to have all the bodyguards claim (yes, you heard me right) because their LITERAL FUNCTION is to die for someone else, them dying by being directly targeted is functionally EXACTLY THE SAME as dying for someone else (the weak bodyguard).

in other words, RC was right, the game IS pretty broken. as long as the weak bodyguard is protected by one, and exactly one, bodyguard each night, there is literally nothing the scum can do to stop us getting as many investigations as possible until we hit scum with the weak bg. WE ARE TRYING TO CLEAR TOWN, NOT HIT SCUM



in the interest of all cards being on the table:

scum's BEST chance of counter-acting this, which, who knows if it'll work, are to:

a) be as townie as possible, to try and draw the weak BG investigatioin, which will kill him, BUT will net us at least one scum, i.e. a sacrifice to the blood gods in order to try to kill the PoE process town HAS ON LOCK

b) claim to be a bodyguard, and when assigned a night to bodyguard the weak bg (we will obv assign them in order of towniest claimed bg to scummiest), kill him instead (which will throw doubt on the person he claimed to be targeting, or if he has chosen to reveal it only the day after (not a bad idea) then we'll just proceed as normal and everyone can pretend to be VTs.

and if we have more bodyguard claims than 3 reg and 1 weak, we know that at least one is scum, and we have another little game within a game.. which we can combat with this mini-game:

mini-game:
as soon as the weak bg flips, the game becomes akin to VTs versus goons for the most part, in terms of numbers, HOWEVER, since bodyguards are basically conftown (unless there are more of them than 3 reg & 1 weak) they should still coordinate beforehand who they are guarding, and guard the towniest players which AREN'T each other.

and if 3 regular bodyguards die, we know who the scum is, because it'll be the other bodyguards that haven't died.



BOOM. game broken.

It is.

Spoiler: Baggage, Optional Reading
I am frustrated with forum mafia right now and I haven't had a good game since way back at Christmas with Badass Female UPick. I love the concept of mafia because I read crappy Victorian mysteries all the time and I like the puzzle solving aspect, but in the last few months the games I've played have just turned out terribly. This was in no small part because I've had a pretty bad streak of drawing scum and I absolutely hate being scum. Posting becomes a chore and I drag my feet. I'm no good at telling people what they want to hear because I'm already socially awkward and it's not one of my strengths. It doesn't help that I have the charisma and likability of a dried up cat turd. The couple times I did draw town, I become an emotional, bitter wreck and by the end of the game I ended up turning into a heinous bitch that was pissed off at everybody.

So coming into this game, I thought I would have the attitude of just trying to enjoy the game and just letting my reads develop at their own pace. These usually don't roll around for a while. I am super slow because I always try to consider all the different interpretations of people's posts and their implications. I only end up sharing about 5% of what I think just because most of it ends up being garbage. (As a side note, this is a large part of the reason why you will see me in hydra games a lot more often than solo games. My hydra partner deals with people and I can take my sweet ass time.)

So, when I saw BNL say "You're not making content on page 2, you're scum!" I was immensely annoyed and just immediately went into bitch mode because I thought "It's not going to be one of those games again, is it?" I'm not sharing what I'm thinking because I'm not ready yet, but I am keeping up and giving this some thought. The old me probably would've ignored BNL and just kept grabassing until she got better reads. But sadly the old me is dead, beaten to a bloody pulp by games of disappointment, mislynches, and angst. Now, getting pushed for bad reasons bugs the shit out of me and drains me. None of this is BNL's fault, but it is how it is.


That was largely irrelevant and probably doesn't make any sense, but I had to vent and get that off my chest now.

I have to go deal with people in RL now. This'll be an adventure. I'll be back this evening.

So this post was supposed to be me catching up and giving detailed thoughts on the VT Pool. I got through my townreads before realizing that having the post hanging over my head was a bad thing.

Townreads
Spoiler: Performer
Reasoning:
1. Miscellaneous Posts that feel town: 442, 466, 911, 918

2. Miscellaneous Posts that feel scum: 912, 448

3. Going after obvtown players (Kush, FourTrouble): It's extra effort that I see town being more likely to put in than scum. Either way Performer should know it's going to be looked on as strange (which is usually scummy) and scum usually have other priorities.

4. Doesn't work well as a partner with either Expedience or BNL: For BNL, 1240 and 1243 really don't feel like scum hammering a partner. For Expedience, it's possible but feels unlikely. Placed his first vote on Performer, did that weird vote/unvote thing with performer, and was voting him until pretty much the end of the day.

5. Counterwagons rose up after he went to L-1: Could be influenced by scumpartners who didn't want him lynched.

Spoiler: RadiantCowbells
1. Misc. Posts that lean town: The combo of 288 & 322-5

this may have been answered already but:

if a bodyguard dies instead of a weak bodyguard, this is a good thing, because a bodyguard cannot act as a cop
if a bodyguard dies instead of any other kill, it's a bad thing, because of the reason you mentioned in your post

if multiple bodyguards target a the person who the mafia try to kill, due to lack of claiming, this is BAD because they both die.

basically, if all bodyguards claim, and claim their targets, and DON'T target the same person as other bodyguards, scum can do no better than one kill per night, AND they CANNOT kill the target they want (ostensibly even if it was a strongman kill) due to how the bodyguard role works.

since we have 3 bodyguards, we can FORCE at least 3 investigations, unless one of them is scum, at which point our luck runs out.

SO, the BEST BEST BEST course of action for town is to have all the bodyguards claim (yes, you heard me right) because their LITERAL FUNCTION is to die for someone else, them dying by being directly targeted is functionally EXACTLY THE SAME as dying for someone else (the weak bodyguard).

in other words, RC was right, the game IS pretty broken. as long as the weak bodyguard is protected by one, and exactly one, bodyguard each night, there is literally nothing the scum can do to stop us getting as many investigations as possible until we hit scum with the weak bg. WE ARE TRYING TO CLEAR TOWN, NOT HIT SCUM



in the interest of all cards being on the table:

scum's BEST chance of counter-acting this, which, who knows if it'll work, are to:

a) be as townie as possible, to try and draw the weak BG investigatioin, which will kill him, BUT will net us at least one scum, i.e. a sacrifice to the blood gods in order to try to kill the PoE process town HAS ON LOCK

b) claim to be a bodyguard, and when assigned a night to bodyguard the weak bg (we will obv assign them in order of towniest claimed bg to scummiest), kill him instead (which will throw doubt on the person he claimed to be targeting, or if he has chosen to reveal it only the day after (not a bad idea) then we'll just proceed as normal and everyone can pretend to be VTs.

and if we have more bodyguard claims than 3 reg and 1 weak, we know that at least one is scum, and we have another little game within a game.. which we can combat with this mini-game:

mini-game:
as soon as the weak bg flips, the game becomes akin to VTs versus goons for the most part, in terms of numbers, HOWEVER, since bodyguards are basically conftown (unless there are more of them than 3 reg & 1 weak) they should still coordinate beforehand who they are guarding, and guard the towniest players which AREN'T each other.

and if 3 regular bodyguards die, we know who the scum is, because it'll be the other bodyguards that haven't died.



BOOM. game broken.

In post 13, Postie wrote:A quick PSA: I was asked about who dies in a chain of bodyguards, where one bodyguard protects another. I should clarify this issue now to avoid confusion.

As stated in the bodyguard role PM, a bodyguard will die in the place of someone targeted by a kill. If a bodyguard protects a player that is targeted by the nightkill, any bodyguards protecting the aforementioned bodyguard will not prevent them from dying.
For example, if player A protects player B and player B protects C and player C is targeted by the nightkill, player B will die and nothing will happen to player A.

This is to stop the set-up from getting unnecessarily complicated and prevent circular protection.
I have added this information to the opening post containing the details of the set-up.

After a hard day at work, Performer was out drinking alone.

"Hey!" Someone approached him and smiled. "Can I sit with you?"

Performer was happy to have company, and he and TellTaleHeart ended up having a lengthy conversation about their shared interest in graveyard architecture.
He was just about to take a sip of his drink when someone tapped him on the shoulder.
"Uh, I'm not sure if I saw what I think I saw..." zakk whispered, "but I think your friend here may have slipped something into your drink."
"Really?" Performer frowned, "Mmm. Well. Thanks for letting me know."

TellTaleHeart seemed sweet enough that Performer wasn't sure he believed zakk, so he just carried on as he'd done before. He switched their drinks when she wasn't looking though, just in case.
After TellTaleHeart excused herself to the bathroom, two other strangers approached Performer.
"From the looks of it that other guy might have warned you about this already, but we wanted to let you know that we saw that woman spike your drink."
"Actually, I noticed it too," someone else chimed in.
Titus overheard what was happening. "You guys could have warned him about this earlier," she said, rolling her eyes. "Someone should probably call the cops."

By the time they arrived, TellTaleHeart's dead body had already been discovered in the bathroom. The police identified the cause of death as cyanide poisoning.

Bellaphant pushed some coins into the vending machine and waited for her coke to drop forward.
It did.
And then it hung there, stuck.

Darn it! she thought, kicking the machine hard enough to hurt her foot but not hard enough to dislodge the bottle.

She gripped onto the sides next and rattled the machine back and forth, and that's when it happened.
She could feel the machine tipping, and time seemed to slow down. She was falling, and the vending machine was falling with her.
Bellaphant was crushed well before she had the chance to think about whether this was more than just an accident.

Bellaphant has been killed night 2! She was a Vanilla Townie.

Spoiler: Baggage, Optional Reading
I am frustrated with forum mafia right now and I haven't had a good game since way back at Christmas with Badass Female UPick. I love the concept of mafia because I read crappy Victorian mysteries all the time and I like the puzzle solving aspect, but in the last few months the games I've played have just turned out terribly. This was in no small part because I've had a pretty bad streak of drawing scum and I absolutely hate being scum. Posting becomes a chore and I drag my feet. I'm no good at telling people what they want to hear because I'm already socially awkward and it's not one of my strengths. It doesn't help that I have the charisma and likability of a dried up cat turd. The couple times I did draw town, I become an emotional, bitter wreck and by the end of the game I ended up turning into a heinous bitch that was pissed off at everybody.

So coming into this game, I thought I would have the attitude of just trying to enjoy the game and just letting my reads develop at their own pace. These usually don't roll around for a while. I am super slow because I always try to consider all the different interpretations of people's posts and their implications. I only end up sharing about 5% of what I think just because most of it ends up being garbage. (As a side note, this is a large part of the reason why you will see me in hydra games a lot more often than solo games. My hydra partner deals with people and I can take my sweet ass time.)

So, when I saw BNL say "You're not making content on page 2, you're scum!" I was immensely annoyed and just immediately went into bitch mode because I thought "It's not going to be one of those games again, is it?" I'm not sharing what I'm thinking because I'm not ready yet, but I am keeping up and giving this some thought. The old me probably would've ignored BNL and just kept grabassing until she got better reads. But sadly the old me is dead, beaten to a bloody pulp by games of disappointment, mislynches, and angst. Now, getting pushed for bad reasons bugs the shit out of me and drains me. None of this is BNL's fault, but it is how it is.


That was largely irrelevant and probably doesn't make any sense, but I had to vent and get that off my chest now.

I have to go deal with people in RL now. This'll be an adventure. I'll be back this evening.

if a bodyguard dies instead of any other kill, it's a bad thing, because of the reason you mentioned in your post

if multiple bodyguards target a the person who the mafia try to kill, due to lack of claiming, this is BAD because they both die.

basically, if all bodyguards claim, and claim their targets, and DON'T target the same person as other bodyguards, scum can do no better than one kill per night, AND they CANNOT kill the target they want (ostensibly even if it was a strongman kill) due to how the bodyguard role works.

since we have 3 bodyguards, we can FORCE at least 3 investigations, unless one of them is scum, at which point our luck runs out.

SO, the BEST BEST BEST course of action for town is to have all the bodyguards claim (yes, you heard me right) because their LITERAL FUNCTION is to die for someone else, them dying by being directly targeted is functionally EXACTLY THE SAME as dying for someone else (the weak bodyguard).

in other words, RC was right, the game IS pretty broken. as long as the weak bodyguard is protected by one, and exactly one, bodyguard each night, there is literally nothing the scum can do to stop us getting as many investigations as possible until we hit scum with the weak bg. WE ARE TRYING TO CLEAR TOWN, NOT HIT SCUM



in the interest of all cards being on the table:

scum's BEST chance of counter-acting this, which, who knows if it'll work, are to:

a) be as townie as possible, to try and draw the weak BG investigatioin, which will kill him, BUT will net us at least one scum, i.e. a sacrifice to the blood gods in order to try to kill the PoE process town HAS ON LOCK

b) claim to be a bodyguard, and when assigned a night to bodyguard the weak bg (we will obv assign them in order of towniest claimed bg to scummiest), kill him instead (which will throw doubt on the person he claimed to be targeting, or if he has chosen to reveal it only the day after (not a bad idea) then we'll just proceed as normal and everyone can pretend to be VTs.

and if we have more bodyguard claims than 3 reg and 1 weak, we know that at least one is scum, and we have another little game within a game.. which we can combat with this mini-game:

mini-game:
as soon as the weak bg flips, the game becomes akin to VTs versus goons for the most part, in terms of numbers, HOWEVER, since bodyguards are basically conftown (unless there are more of them than 3 reg & 1 weak) they should still coordinate beforehand who they are guarding, and guard the towniest players which AREN'T each other.

and if 3 regular bodyguards die, we know who the scum is, because it'll be the other bodyguards that haven't died.

loosely followed this

postie's idea behind the setup where a lot of importance is shifted to the night game is a pretty neat one. and one that i had before, in fact: viewtopic.php?f=84&t=33689

BUT

the setup probably could've been better balanced. massclaim was obviously optimal b/c it created two different lynch pools that would sink scum if the game went on long enough. it effectively made the game white flag. the fact that: 1) the scumteam was fragmented and 2) scum didn't have daytalk, kinda' cut scum off at the knees and didn't let them coordinate claims.

there was also the weak bg. in this case it didn't end up mattering since the titus/fourtrouble slot never ended up doing anything (which may have been a smart move here given town were ahead in the count most of the game) but anybody with at least semi-decent townreads drawing that role would've been game breaking. scum probably needed a 1-shot strongman or something to make it not optimal for them to claim on day 1.

the consequences were that it didn't leave scum with much room for error at all. it was either going to be a perfect scum sweep or a town curbstomp. so yeah... i probably didn't think things through as much as i should've in the review. my bad.
